title: Leadership Competency Development: Long-Term Safety Capacity Building for International Aid Workers

context.prior_knowledge: Basic Concepts of International Development Cooperation and Fieldwork Experience
context.additional_context: Practical Competency Enhancement Program for Corporate Management/HR Professionals

learning_goals: Learners can identify site-specific risk factors and explain safety planning procedures
Learners can perform decision-making and response processes during emergencies using VR simulations

Learners draft a team safety protocol manual reflecting industrial safety standards (e.g., KOSHA) within six months, conduct at least three training sessions based on the manual, and achieve participant satisfaction rates of 80% or higher.

Learners, by the end of a six-month course, analyze security event logs at least once monthly using SIEM (e.g., Splunk, QRadar) and EDR tools, and identify/report anomalies according to a predefined 5-step monitoring checklist.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
